file_content.text: I ask you--be done with this.
The nest has withdrawn. House Cortess is safe--for now.
I think we came out of this alright.
Looks like it.
So it seems.
You turned on the nest. That couldn't have been easy.
How are you holding up?
The nest transformed us into the Dawn Herald. The nest gave us peace and understanding. But we were always the Empire's emissary.
If it weren't for your Killiks, they wouldn't have been in danger in the first place.
No thanks to you.
Yes. We apologize for the... misunderstanding.
I am grateful for your aid. House Cortess has suffered enough.
The Empire will expect your cooperation in the future.
You serve us, now.
I assure you, House Cortess will make restitution.
You've endured some terrible losses, Baron.
You have my sympathy.
The weeks ahead may prove trying. But we will endure.
You'll suffer more if you don't clean up your act.
I can make it worse.
The baroness was a mistake--one I take full responsibility for, and one I will not repeat.
Baron--perhaps you'd allow us access to your computers? We're certain our superiors would like to see the baroness's files.
Captain Perovius? Arrange it. I must see to our defenses--in case anyone else would take advantage of our humbled state.
Uru bu ubur.
The hive is secure. The injured will be tended to and transformed; the dead will feed the larvae.
It's all over, then. The terrorists and Cortess... gone.
Job's finished.
Couldn't have happened to a nicer family.
They deserve it.
They'll become valued members of the nest.
I went along with this, Vector, but I don't need the details.
I don't want to know.
Of course. We understand.
Now--we'd like to bring this mission to a close. With your permission, we'll upload House Cortess's data to Imperial Intelligence...
This is Keeper to Cipher Nine. I'm receiving your transmission; Watchers are reviewing the Cortess logs now.
It looks like you've wrapped up the terrorist financing situation. Congratulations.
I'm proud to be of service, sir.
Thank you.
Keeper--I wasn't expecting to hear from you.
This is a surprise.
I pay close attention to my operations.
How can you be certain so quickly?
You're sure it's over?
Vector Hyllus has been filing interim reports. The Cortess logs are our final confirmation.
Preliminary analysis suggests the Eagle's terror network will run low on funds within weeks.
The cells will look for alternative credit sources, of course. Let's not give them the chance to find any.
We'll keep them on the run. Anything else?
Understood.
One other thing.
Time to leave Alderaan.
The Eagle will be long dead by that point.
They'll be in deeper trouble.
Excellent. Now, I have news for you. Both of you.
I contacted Vector's superiors in the Diplomatic Service, and we've reached an agreement.
Sir?
Your requisition has been made permanent. You've been officially transferred to Imperial Intelligence.
Cipher Nine--from now on, Vector Hyllus will act as a covert assault agent under your command. Understood?
Understood. Welcome aboard, Vector.
Very well.
We'll do our best to live up to expectations.
Sir--don't I get some say?
Can we discuss this?
No. Imperial Intelligence believes Vector Hyllus is a useful tool, and someone needs to test him.
I don't trust him, Keeper--he's more Killik than anything else.
We can't rely on Vector.
His Killik alterations make him an excellent tool.
We understand your mistrust. We'll do our best to demonstrate we're worthy of the position.
Once you're through on Alderaan, return to your ship for debriefing. Watcher Two should have updates ready for you.
In the meantime, instruct Vector as you see fit. I expect he'll require additional training.
Done.
He'll be a superior agent in no time.
I'm confident in him.
I'm sure Vector and I will make a good team.
Sounds fun.
Give me time. I can whip him into shape.
I'll make him work.
Good. Stay alert, Cipher. Keeper out.
Agent. We're... grateful for this opportunity. After fighting the nest--we don't think we can return to the hive.
This is for the best. I expect you'll be an asset.
It'll work out well.
Fighting the Killiks was the right thing to do. Remember that.
You did good.
Of course. Thank you.
We'll follow the rhythm of the Song of the Universe--until the Great Merging comes.
Don't thank me. Keeper made the choice.
I'm just following orders.
We understand. We're grateful nonetheless, and we will serve--both as Dawn Herald and as operative of Imperial Intelligence.
The nest is pleased with the Empire and encourages this opportunity. We remain Dawn Herald--but we will travel at your side.
I'm glad the nest approves. I'm looking forward to this.
Good.
Yes. Our nest song will harmonize with the Empire for many years to come.
You've been with the Killiks a long time. Any anxiety about leaving the hive?
Will you be okay?
Perhaps. It has been our home since transformation.
But... we've always been an emissary. First from the Empire to the Killiks, and now from the Killiks to the galaxy. It should be a fascinating experience.
Just stay quiet and obey orders.
Shut up, Vector.
Acknowledged. We'll await your commands.
What have you done?
Baron, I beg of you...
You have made an enemy of the Empire! You have brought vermin into my house!
I swear, I only wanted to protect us!
Silence!
My honored guest. I bow my head in surrender... and I apologize for what's become of Cortess.
I'm here for your wife, Baron. She's committed terrorist offenses against the Empire.
I want the baroness.
I fought the only way I could. All I ever had was money....
You had no idea what your wife's been up to?
You're not in on all this?
It is the truth.
It's too late for apologies, Baron.
I don't think so.
Nonetheless. I know what is required.
Urrub burr.
Our reinforcements have arrived. We will attack on your signal.
I knew nothing of my wife's conspiracy. She only confessed once the house defenses were down.
But I will make amends. Now, Captain.
You're an honorable man. I appreciate your sacrifice.
It's settled, then.
She didn't have to die. How could you?
That wasn't necessary!
I had no other choice.
Now take your... insects away from this place. We can discuss further recompense as civilized people.
We're afraid that's not your decision, Baron.
Rurr uub.
Denri Ayl and the baroness are dead. With our assistance, the terrorist funding has been stopped. Now the nest will claim its price.
What are you talking about, Vector?
What?
I should've expected something like this. What do you want, Vector?
I knew this wouldn't work out.
We're standing in a woman's blood. Can't this wait?
Not right now!
Apologies, but it can't.
House Cortess will make a perfect extension of the hive. These rooms will become egg chambers and membrosia pools. The family can become Joiners.
What? You cannot do this! I gave you my wife!
House Cortess opposed the Empire and must be subdued. The nest is growing and must expand its territory.
I never agreed to anything like that.
This wasn't our deal.
You agreed to an alliance, surely?
Let's sit down and discuss.
We don't understand.
By allowing the Killiks to absorb House Cortess, both the Empire and the nest benefit. Why would you object?
The baron gave us what we needed. The threat is over.
Cortess isn't our enemy.
A member of House Cortess acted against the Empire. Therefore, it is the will of House Cortess to oppose you.
The nest... doesn't distinguish between the actions of groups and individuals. And the colony must expand.
Forcing people to Join the nest is wrong. Can't you understand that?
This is immoral.
The Joining is part of the Killik way. How can that be wrong?
You lied to me, Vector.
This was all a Killik trick
We're incapable of deception. We apologize if this action came as a surprise.
Urr rur urbu.
Agent. We--I--must know if you intend to oppose us. If you do, the nest will fight to defend its claim.
I'm not letting you take these people.
I won't allow it.
Very well. We understand--and our loyalty to the Empire comes first.
We hope your decision is the right one.
Would you fight me, too?
What about you?
We... would not. Our loyalty to the Empire comes first.
We have to defend Cortess. I'm glad you're on my side.
Then we protect these people.
Time to squish some bugs.
Get ready to fight Killiks.
We understand. We'll do what needs to be done.
Men--defend the baron!
I just needed to be sure. Tell the nest that Cortess is theirs.
Then you can kill the nobles.
I won't oppose you. I just needed to understand.
Go ahead and absorb Cortess.
Do what you have to do. I'm finished here.
Fine with me.
Excellent. We will secure the estate. The injured will be tended to and transformed; the dead will feed the larvae.
Your wife may be dead--but she was part of your house. Vector, tell the Killiks to attack.
Vector? Let's kill everyone.
Excellent. The nest is pleased. These rooms are perfect for egg chambers and membrosia pools. The family can become Joiners.
Damn you. Damn all of you. House Cortess will have revenge...
Protect the baron and attack!
I've made no progress searching for Denri Ayl. But I will.
I apologize, but I'm very busy right now.
You'll have to schedule an audience for another time, I'm afraid.
